alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 1:16PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino County through 145 PM MST... At 115 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Valle, or 32 miles southwest of Desert View at Grand Canyon, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, up to half inch hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ten-x Campground. This includes State Route 64 between mile markers 217 and 232. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
